Entries.default:
A heavy brass bombard is perched atop the wall, pointing out to sea.

From here, you have a commanding view of the flooded fortress.
[Leave the bombard alone.]
The bombard continues its lonely vigil.
[Load the bombard.]
Carefully, you ease the shell into the bombard.

"You know that swell of fatherly pride when you see a newborn?

"Getting my taste of it." 

Maia pats the hide of the weapon.

You light the fuse and plug your ears.

Carefully, you ease the shell into the bombard.

It's now loaded and pointed toward the sea.
The gears at its base are rusted stuck. It will take some kind of lubricating oil - or an incredible amount of force - to move the platform.
[Fire the bombard.]

You try, but it's stuck.

Looking down, you notice the gears attached to the rotating platform are rusted.
[Push the bombard into position.]

"Captain? All due respect, but we'll make it out of here faster without a gaping hole in our ship." 

Maia bites her lower lip and squints to adjust the aim.

"Whoever was shirking their maintenance duty had better be among the casualties." 

Maia glowers at the sorry state of the platform.
[Rub cooking fat into the gears.]
It's messy and smelly work, but once the gears - and your arms - are liberally greased, you're able to turn the bombard.
[Scan the fortress.]

Broken towers rise feebly from the water, and corpses and debris float between them.

You see no sign of life until you note movement near the center of the fort.

A large cluster of nāga has congregated on the central walkway.

You adjust the bombard's angle to account for the proper trajectory.
[Check for ammunition.]
The bombard itself is not loaded, and you don't see any ammunition for it nearby.
